Then the **Great Threat** arrives: *Zhuǎnwēi* (纂微), Sīmǎ (司马), Sū (苏), Cáo (曹), Chén (陈), and Yè (叶) all omit the character **矣** (矣).

**"Do not narrow their dwellings":** Lù (陆) and Wáng Bì (王弼) read *xiá* (狭) as *xiá* (狎), pronounced *hùjiǎ* (户甲), with *Guǎngyuàn* (广韵) noting *xiá* (狭) sounds like *xiá* (峡). *Zhuǎnwēi* (纂微) reads *xiá* (狭) as *xiá* (狎); Sīmǎ (司马) reads *jū* (居) as *ān* (安).

**"Only the unwearied":** Lù (陆) reads *yàn* (厌) as *yàn* (於艳切), with Lǐ (李) omitting it. *Zhuǎnwēi* (纂微) reads *wéi* (惟) as *wéi* (唯).

**"Manifest":** Lù (陆) reads *xiàn* (见) as *xiàn* (贤遍切), with Lǐ (李) reading it as *xiǎn* (显).

**"Thus depart":** Lù (陆) reads *qù* (去) as *qù* (羌吕切).

---
**Chapter Seventy-Three: The Bold in Dare Become Slaughter**
*River Upper Text* reads as **"Task as One’s Own"** (rèn wéi). Sū (苏), Wǔ Zhù (五注), and Huáng Běn (黄本) all read as **"The Bold in Dare"** (yǒng yú gǎn).

**"These two":** *Zhuǎnwēi* (纂微), Sīmǎ (司马), Cáo (曹), and Chén (陈) have the character **zhī** (知) above; Sū (苏) omits it.

**"Hate":** Lù (陆) reads as *wū* (乌路切).

**"Yet difficult":** Lù (陆) reads *nán* (难) as *nǎn* (乃旦切), with Lǐ (李) in level tone; Sū (苏) reads *yóu* (犹) as *yóu* (尤); Shào (邵) reads *yóu* (犹) as *yóu* (由).

**"Unrestrained":** Lù (陆) reads *tǎn* (坦) as *tǔdàn* (吐但切), meaning "spacious in appearance." *River Upper Text* has one reading as *chān* (墠), meaning "broad." *Zhuǎnwēi* (纂微) reads *tǎn* (坦) as *mò* (默); Sīmǎ (司马), Sū (苏), Cáo (曹), Chén (陈), Yè (叶), and Chéng (程) all read as *tàn* (谭), pronounced *xuàn* (阐).

**"Vast and expansive":** Lù (陆) reads as *kǔhuí* (苦回切).

---
**Chapter Seventy-Four: The People Do Not Fear Constantly**
*River Upper Text* reads as **"Subdue Deceit"** (zhì huò). Sū (苏) reads as **"The People Do Not Fear Death"** (mín bù wèi sǐ). Qīngyuán (清源), Huáng (黄), and Chéng (程) all read as **"The People Do Not Fear Death Constantly"** (mín cháng bù wèi sǐ).

**"If one makes the people":** Sīmǎ (司马), Sū (苏), Cáo (曹), and Chén (陈) read *mín* (民) as *rén* (人).

**"Strange":** Lǐ (李) reads as *qí* (奇, as the character itself).

**"I, who would seize and kill them? Who dares?"** Sīmǎ (司马) has **fú** (夫) above *shú* (孰) and **yě** (也) below. *Zhuǎnwēi* (纂微), Sīmǎ (司马), Sū (苏), Wǔ Zhù (五注), Cáo (曹), Chén (陈), Dázhēn (达真), Yè (叶), Qīngyuán (清源), Huáng (黄), and Chéng (程) all read *qǐ* (岂) as *dé* (得).

**"And substitute to kill those who kill":** *Zhuǎnwēi* (纂微) and Cáo (曹) read **ér** (而) as **fú** (夫), omitting the character **shā** (杀). Sīmǎ (司马), Sū (苏), and Yè (叶) read only **ér** (而) as **fú** (夫). Wǔ Zhù (五注) omits the character **shā** (杀) below. Chén (陈) omits both **ér** (而) above and **shā** (杀) below.

**Chapter Seventy-Six: The People’s Life**

*"Hunger":*
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Sū, Wǔ Zhù, Cáo, Chén, Dázhēn, and Yè all read as **"hunger"** (jī).
*Guǎngyùn* records *jī* (饥), *jū yī* (居依) rhyme, meaning "grain not ripened," and *jī* (饥), *jū yí* (居夷) rhyme, meaning "starvation." It is likely that *jī* (饥) is the correct reading.

*"Because of the excessive taxes on their upper food":*
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Sū, Cáo, Chén, and Yè all omit the character **"because"** (以).

*"The people are difficult to govern because of the excessive actions of their superiors, and thus difficult to govern":*
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Sū, Cáo, Chén, and Yè all omit the character **"because"** (以).
Wǔ Zhù omits these fifteen characters entirely.

*"People’s contempt for death":*
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, and Qīngyuán read **"people’s cursing"** (rèn) instead of **"people’s contempt"** (qīng).

*"Because of the abundance of their means to sustain life":*
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Cáo, and Chén all read **"because of their seeking life"** (qiú shēng), omitting the character **"because"** (以) below.
Sū and Yè omit only the character **"because"** (以).

*"Only those who do not take life as their priority":*
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Sū, Cáo, Chén, and Dázhēn all have the character **"husband"** (fú) above.

*"This is more virtuous than valuing life":*
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Cáo, Sū, and Chén all omit the character **"because"** (以).
Yè has the character **"because"** (以) below **"this"** (shì), reading **"because"** (yě) as **"husband"** (fú).

---
**Chapter Seventy-Six: The People’s Life**
*River Upper Text* reads as **"Admonish the Strong"** (jiè qiáng).
Sū and Cáo’s original texts both read as **"Chapter on the People’s Life"** (mín zhī shēng zhāng).
Qīngyuán’s text reads as **"Chapter on Life and Death: The Gentle Weakness"** (rén zhī shēng sǐ yě róu ruò zhāng).

*"The people’s life":*
Sīmǎ, Sū, Cáo, Chén, and Yè all read **"the people"** (mín) instead of **"the people’s"** (rén).

*"Their death is firm and strong":*
Lù reads **"strong"** (qiáng) as *qiáng* (强), *qí liǎng* (其两) rhyme, or *qí liáng* (其良) rhyme.
Yè omits the character **"because"** (yě).

*"The life of grasses and trees is tender and fragile":*
Lù reads **"fragile"** (cuì) as *cuì* (脆), *qī suì* (七岁) rhyme.
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Sū, Cáo, and Chén all have **"all things"** (wàn wù) above, omitting the character **"of"** (zhī).
Chéng omits the character **"because"** (yě).
Sū and Yè read **"fragile"** (cuì) as **"weak"** (ruò).

*"Those who are destined to die are those who are destined to live":*
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Sū, Wǔ Zhù, Cáo, Chén, Yè, and Qīngyuán all omit the character **"because"** (yě).

*"Shared":*
Pronounced *gǒng* (拱).
Huáng reads **"shared"** (gòng) as **"folded"** (zhé).

*"Thus, the firm and strong are positioned below":*
Qīngyuán omits the character **"thus"** (gù).
Huáng reads **"positioned"** (jū) as **"placed"** (chǔ).
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Sū, Cáo, Chén, Yè, and Chéng all read as **"the great and strong are placed below"** (qiángdà chǔ xià).

---
**Chapter Seventy-Seven: The Dao of Heaven**
*River Upper Text* reads as **"The Dao of Heaven"** (tiān dào).

chunks.original_text: 其犹张弓乎：邵犹作由。 补之：《纂微》、司马、苏、曹、陈补并作与。 孰能损有余而奉不足於天下者其唯道乎：《纂微》、司马、苏、曹、陈、叶、程并作孰能以有余奉天下唯有道者。 功成不居：《纂微》、司马、苏、曹、陈并居作处。 见贤耶：李见如字，《纂微》、曹、陈无耶字，叶贤上有其字。 天下柔弱章第七十八 河上本作任信，清源本作天下莫柔弱於水章。 天下莫柔弱於水：《纂微》、司马、苏、曹、陈并作天下柔弱莫过於水，叶同，上又作莫胜於水，陈同，上以柔之至。 莫之能先：《纂微》、司马、苏、曹、陈、叶先并作胜。 以其无以易之也：李易，如字，移也，改也，《纂微》、苏、曹、陈并上无以字下无也字，叶同，上又无其字。 柔之胜刚弱之胜强：《纂微》、司马、苏、古开并上有故字，无二之字，陈、叶无二之字。 天下莫不知而莫之能行：司马、苏、曹、陈、叶、无而之二字。 圣人言：司马作圣人之言云。 受国之不祥：《纂微》、司马、苏、曹、叶、清源、黄、程并无之字。 是为：《纂微》、司马、苏、五注、曹、陈、达真、叶、清源、黄、程、邵并为作谓。 正言若反：司马上有故字，下有也字。 和大怨章第七十九 河上本作任契。 和大怨者：《纂微》、曹、陈、叶并无者字。 必有余怨：叶无必字。 契李若计切，心也，左为阳，心属阳，以其能合前境，故曰契。 彻：李直列切，法也，通也。 小国寡民章第八十 河上本作独立。 使民有什伯之器：《纂微》、司马、曹、陈并无民字。 而不用也：《纂微》、司马、苏、曹、陈、叶、黄、程并无也字。 使民重死而不远徙：李徙，斯民切，司马远徙作重复，苏、叶无此一句。 使民复结绳而用之：李绳，食陵切，上古之政，清源上有故字。 安其俗：《纂微》、司马、苏、曹、陈、黄俗并作居。 乐其业：《纂微》、司马、苏、曹、陈、黄业并作俗。 邻国相望：林望，一作平声，与冠盖相望同。 声：《纂微》、司马、苏、曹、陈、黄并作音。 使民至：《纂微》、司马、苏、曹、陈并无使字。 不相与往来：《纂微》、司马、苏、五注、曹、陈、达真、叶、清源、黄、程并无与字，黄、程上有而字。 信言不美章第八十一 河上本作显质。 无积：《纂微》、司马、曹、陈无并作不。 天之道：五注无之字。 道德真经集注释文竟

**Chapter Seventy-Eight: The Dao of Heaven’s Gentleness**
River Upper reads as **"The Dao of Heaven’s Task"** (rèn xìn).

None in the world is gentler than water:
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Sū, Cáo, and Chén all read as:
*"None surpasses water in gentleness."*
(Yè follows, and River Upper reads as **"None overcomes water in gentleness"** (mò shèng yú shuǐ),
while Chén follows, reading **"None is gentler than water"** (mò guò yú shuǐ).

None can precede it:
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Sū, Cáo, and Chén all read **"precede"** (xiān) as **"overcome"** (shèng).

Because of its inability to be exchanged:
Lǐ reads **"exchanged"** (yì) as **"like"** (rú), meaning **"moved"** (yí) or **"changed"** (gǎi).
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sū, Cáo, and Chén omit the characters **"Because of"** (yǐ qí) and **"it"** (zhī).
Yè follows, and River Upper reads as:
*"Because of its inability to be changed."*

The gentle overcomes the hard, the weak overcomes the strong:
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Sū, and Gǔ kāi all omit the character **"thus"** (gù)
and add the characters **"the gentle"** (róu) and **"the weak"** (ruò),
while Chén and Yè omit the characters **"the gentle"** (róu) and **"the weak"** (ruò).

None in the world does not know it, yet none can practice it:
Sīmǎ, Sū, Cáo, Chén, and Yè omit the characters **"it"** (zhī) and **"yet"** (ér).

The Sage says:

**Receiving the misfortunes of a state**:
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Sū, Cáo, and Yè, along with Qīngyuán, Huáng, and Chéng,

**This is called**:
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Sū, Wǔ Zhù, Cáo, Chén, Dá Zhēn, Yè, Qīngyuán, Huáng, and Chéng
all read **"called"** (wéi) as **"said"** (wèi).

**Right words seem like wrong ones**:
Sīmǎ adds the characters **"thus"** (gù) and **"it"** (yě).

**Chapter Seventy-Nine: Harmonizing Great Grievances**
River Upper reads as **"The Dao of Heaven’s Task"** (rèn qiè).

**Those who harmonize great grievances**:
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Cáo, Chén, and Yè all omit the character **"those"** (zhě).

**Must have remaining grievances**:
Yè omits the character **"must"** (bì).

**Contract** (qiè) is pronounced *jì* (计), meaning **"heart"** (xīn).
The left side is **yin**, and the heart belongs to **yin**,
because it can **contract** (hé) with the past **forms** (jìng).
**Pierce** (chè) is pronounced *zhíliè* (直列), meaning **"law"** (fǎ) or **"through"** (tōng).

**Chapter Eighty: The Small State with Few People**
River Upper reads as **"Standing Alone"** (dú lì).

**Let the people have ten-thousandths of a hundredth of weapons**:
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Cáo, and Chén all omit the character **"people"** (mín).

**Yet they do not use them**:
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Sū, Cáo, Chén, Yè, Huáng, and Chéng all omit the character **"them"** (yě).

**Let the people return to using knotted cords and find them useful**:
Lǐ reads **"knotted cords"** (shéng) as *"shílíng"* (食陵).

**Calm their customs**:

**Delight in their occupations**:
*Zhuǎnwēi*, Sīmǎ, Sū, Cáo, Chén, and Huáng all read **"occupations"** (yè) as **"customs"** (sú).

**Let the people reach**:
